alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 9:43AM EDT until April 30 at 2:40AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Westham affecting City of Richmond, Chesterfield and Henrico Counties. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Richmond Westham, Cartersville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River At Richmond Westham. * WHEN...From this afternoon to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding occurs along both banks, but no damage occurs at this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage by this afternoon and will crest around 12.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tonight before falling to 9.1 feet early Monday morning. It will rise to 9.7 feet Monday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 09/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM EDT.
